intro: Sphaerostephanos sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sumatra in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and thrives in tropical climates. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
